meaning: An endothermic reaction in which energy is transferred from the environment to the chloroplasts by light.
An exothermic reaction which is continuously occurring in living cells.
Controlled by temperature, light intensity, carbon dioxide concentration and the amount of chlorophyll.
A simple sugar produced in photosynthesis, which can be used for respiration, converted into starch, or used to produce certain substances.
A type of respiration using oxygen, producing carbon dioxide and water.
A type of respiration where insufficient oxygen is provided, producing lactic acid.
Anaerobic respiration in yeast cells, has importance in the manufacture of bread and alcoholic drinks.
The sum of all reactions in a cell or the body.
